dt: {bc}a seat typically having four legs and a back for one person
{bc}an official seat or a seat of authority, state, or dignity
{bc}an office or position of authority or dignity
{bc}a position of employment usually of one occupying a chair or desk
{bc}the position of a player in an orchestra or band
{bc}any of various devices that hold up or support

et: Middle English {it}chaiere{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}cathedra{/it}, from Greek {it}kathedra{/it}, from {it}kata-{/it} cata- + {it}hedra{/it} seat {ma}{mat|sit|}{/ma}
shortdef: a seat typically having four legs and a back for one person
an official seat or a seat of authority, state, or dignity

dt: {bc}to carry on the shoulders in acclaim

dt.t: we {wi}chaired{/wi} you through the market place

shortdef: to carry on the shoulders in acclaim

fl: noun, plural in form but singular in construction

dt: {bc}a game in which players march to music around a row of chairs numbering one less than the players and scramble for seats when the music stops
{bc}a situation or series of events suggesting the game of musical chairs (as in rapid change or confusing activity)

shortdef: a game in which players march to music around a row of chairs numbering one less than the players and scramble for seats when the music stops; also : a situation or series of events suggesting the game of musical chairs (as in rapid change or confusing activity)

dt: {bc}a wooden lawn chair with a high slatted back, broad arms, and a seat that is lower in the back than the front

et: after the {et_link|adirondack mountains|Adirondack Mountains:g}, New York
shortdef: a wooden lawn chair with a high slatted back, broad arms, and a seat that is lower in the back than the front

dt: {bc}an armless chair with leather-covered cushions on a stainless steel frame

shortdef: an armless chair with leather-covered cushions on a stainless steel frame

dt: {bc}a hooded and sometimes glassed wheeled chair used especially by invalids

shortdef: a hooded and sometimes glassed wheeled chair used especially by invalids; broadly : wheelchair

dt: {bc}a chair for lounging consisting of a cloth sling supported by a frame of metal tubing or bars

shortdef: a chair for lounging consisting of a cloth sling supported by a frame of metal tubing or bars

dt: {bc}an armchair with a saddle seat and a low curved back with vertical spindles

shortdef: an armchair with a saddle seat and a low curved back with vertical spindles

dt: {bc}a deep low thickly upholstered easy chair often with rather low back and heavy sides and arms

shortdef: a deep low thickly upholstered easy chair often with rather low back and heavy sides and arms

dt: {bc}one of two or more {d_link|chairpersons|chairperson} who preside jointly over something (such as a meeting, organization, committee, event, or department) {bc}{sx|cochairperson||}

dt.t: A short while later she agreed to serve as honorary {wi}cochair{/wi} of the Komen Foundation's Race for the Cure …
After a real estate client introduced her to George Herman House, she didn't hesitate to lend her support. She's been {wi}co-chair{/wi} of the board for five years.
… today she is the department chair of the Foreign Language department and {wi}co-chair{/wi} of the English as a Second Language department …

utxt.t: … a new antidrug commission—{wi}cochaired{/wi} by a corporate leader and a high-ranking administration official …

shortdef: one of two or more chairpersons who preside jointly over something (such as a meeting, organization, committee, event, or department) : cochairperson
